data.title: Go for the Chinese food and not the atmosphere
data.text: The restaurant could use a remodel on the inside, but the meals are great and the egg rolls are the best around.  You will have plenty of leftovers!   It's more popular as a carry-out restaurant than dine-in.

data.title: Fresh ingredients
data.text: Ate here for the first time - was surprised how fresh the ingredients tasted and the chicken was higher quality than usual. The food had good taste. You can ask them to make your food without MSG. You can also ask them to add spice or include spice on the side for carryout. It was also cheaper than other Chinese restaurants. We'll be back to try again.

data.title: Good Carry Out
data.text:
My family was debating about where to get chinese carry out and I remembered we had gotten ffood from this restaurant many years ago.  We could not find a menu online I called the restaurant and asked if they had a menu online.  The person replied not but he could text or email a menu.  We decide to receive the menu by email and we called our selections in after reviewing the menu.  My husband picked up our food in the twenty minutes that they said it would be ready.  The food we received was very tasty and hot. The fact that it was hot is important to me, I do not like warm food from a restaurant. It makes me question how long it has been sitting. My daughter had enough food for two meals, my husband and I had enough for two.  We were very happy with the quality and quantity of the food.  Something different, which I do remember from years ago, they give you yeast rolls instead of crackers.  My only complaint was, we didn't get fortune cookies :)  
Some have complained about the interior, I can not make a comment, because this was a carry out.  My husband did not mention anything out of the ordinary.

data.title: Dirty and below average food
data.text:
Place is really dirty.  Ceiling tiles stained, carper dirty and stained, old padded metal chairs in poor repair
Chicken tough and of poor quality.  I would not return

data.title: Best Chinese food for over 40 years
data.text: I used to frequent Wing Hong when I was a child growing up in the Detroit area.  I brought my family to Detroit for vacation, and we visited Wing Hong.  Now I know why every Chinese restaurant I've visited since is a let-down.  I've lived all over the country, but Wing Hong is by far the best Chinese food I've ever had.  My kids who are picky eaters also loved it.  The WonTon soup is delicious--the broth is so full of flavor.  The sesame chicken is without rival.  All white meat pieces with a delicious sauce.  Their classic, Woo Dip Har, has not changed in 40 years.  It's shrimp wrapped in bacon in a sweet and sour sauce.  Delicious!!  I only wish I lived closer so we could enjoy Wing Hong more often.

data.title: I can't rate it lower than a 1
data.text:
In short, the wait for a menu and food was extensive. The Won Tin soup was closer to dumplings since there was no meat in the dough. The cook must have gone on break when making the Gen Tso's Chicken. No kidding, I couldn't bite into the food as it was too tough. I have up about a quarter of the way in. The waitress asked if I was through already. My response was, "I think it's through with me." Save yourself frustration and general pain and find different restaurant. 

PS--I looked at their website... Deceiving pics.

data.title: Is Wing Hong a Chinese restaurant anymore
data.text: My wife and I had not eaten from this restaurant in five years since we considered it mediocre. We thought it improved in five years. We got food to go. We each had egg rolls. I ordered sweet and sour chicken. I told them to add more vegetables and pineapple and less chicken. My wife ordered vegetable Chow Mein. At home we discovered insipid egg rolls that only tasted of steamed cabbage. one tiny shrimp and mystery white meat bits. My chicken was like "chicken McNuggets". With it was a small container with three small pieces of pineapple, five small slices of carrot and a glutinous sauce that looked and tasted like melted Gummy Bears. My wife's chow mein was overwhelmed with garlic. I don't know if this restaurant was recently sold but, the current owners should consider it. Awful!
